episodeTitle: Where Can Freedom be Found? A Sad Departure of a Boy!
episodeTitleJapanese: 自由はどこにある？少年の悲しき船出
episodeTitleRomanized: Jiyū wa Doko ni Aru? Shōnen no Kanashiki Funade
description: While Dadan and Ace stay behind to confront Bluejam in the burning Gray Terminal, Luffy and the rest of the bandits escape. Meanwhile, Sabo comes to terms with his lack of freedom in Goa Kingdom and decides to leave the island on the day a Celestial Dragon is scheduled to arrive. Dragon and the Revolutionary Army rescue the Gray Terminal residents.

openingSong.title: Fight Together
openingSong.titleJapanese: ファイト・トゥゲザー

events.title: Sabo's Family Confines Him
events.description: After Sabo's previous escape attempt, his father Outlook III hires two bodyguards to guard Sabo and prevent him from leaving. Sabo is confined to his noble family's home against his will.
events.significance: This confinement strengthens Sabo's resolve to escape the Goa Kingdom and seek freedom, setting up his tragic departure later in the episode.

events.title: Dadan and Ace vs Bluejam
events.description: While Luffy and the rest of the Dadan Family escape the burning Gray Terminal, Dadan and Ace refuse to run away and stay behind to fight Bluejam. Despite the fire growing increasingly dangerous, the two team up to confront the evil pirate captain.
events.significance: This battle demonstrates Ace's bravery and Dadan's protective maternal instinct. Their willingness to fight despite overwhelming danger shows their strength of character.

events.title: Luffy Escapes the Gray Terminal Fire
events.description: Luffy and the rest of the Dadan Family bandits make a quick escape from the burning Gray Terminal while Dadan and Ace stay behind to fight Bluejam.
events.significance: This ensures Luffy's safety while setting up the dramatic rescue of Ace and Dadan in the following episode.

events.title: Revolutionary Army Rescues Gray Terminal Residents
events.description: The residents of Gray Terminal are trapped by flames with no way out when suddenly a strong wind opens a path for them. Dragon, Kuma, and Ivankov are waiting at a ship, and Dragon welcomes the people to join the Revolutionary Army.
events.significance: This event demonstrates the Revolutionary Army's mission to save the oppressed and showcases Dragon's power to manipulate wind. It's also the first time Kuma is shown as a Revolutionary.

events.title: Sabo Escapes on a Fishing Boat
events.description: Sabo fully accepts that he will never have freedom so long as he stays in Goa Kingdom. He steals a small fishing boat and sets sail on the day the Celestial Dragon is scheduled to arrive, hoisting a pirate flag to begin his life as a pirate.
events.significance: This is Sabo's declaration of freedom and his decision to leave his noble family behind forever. It sets up the tragic encounter with the Celestial Dragon and changes the course of his life.

quotes.text: I'm setting out to sea! I'm finally free!
quotes.speaker: Sabo
quotes.context: Sabo's declaration as he sails away from Goa Kingdom

events.title: Saint Jalmack's Debut
events.description: Saint Jalmack, a Celestial Dragon, arrives in Goa Kingdom on his massive ship. As Sabo's small fishing boat crosses his path, Jalmack takes offense at a commoner daring to sail near him.
events.significance: This introduces one of the most despicable Celestial Dragons and sets up the tragic event that will change Sabo's life forever.

events.title: Jalmack Shoots Down Sabo's Boat
events.description: Offended that Sabo's fishing boat crossed in front of his ship, Saint Jalmack shoots at the boat with a bazooka, claiming that anyone raising a pirate flag deserves to be treated as a criminal. The boat explodes and burns, with Sabo apparently killed in the blast.
events.significance: This is one of the most tragic and pivotal moments in One Piece, showcasing the cruelty of the Celestial Dragons and appearing to kill one of Luffy and Ace's sworn brothers. The event fuels the brothers' hatred of the nobility and injustice. Later revealed that Sabo survived but lost his memories.

quotes.text: How dare a commoner's boat cut in front of mine! That pirate flag means you're a criminal who deserves to die!
quotes.speaker: Jalmack
quotes.context: Jalmack's justification before shooting Sabo's boat

events.title: Dragon Rescues Sabo
events.description: As Sabo's boat burns and sinks, Dragon dives into the water and rescues the heavily injured boy from drowning. Sabo is critically wounded with severe burns and on the verge of death, but Dragon saves him and brings him to the Revolutionary Army ship.
events.significance: This event saves Sabo's life and leads to him joining the Revolutionary Army. However, Sabo loses his memories of Luffy and Ace due to his injuries, meaning Dragon doesn't know Sabo is his son's sworn brother. This won't be revealed until much later in the series.

events.title: Dadan and Ace Defeat Bluejam
events.description: After a fierce battle in the burning Gray Terminal, Dadan and Ace successfully defeat Bluejam. Ace manages to strangle him while Dadan beats him down. The pirate captain is left unconscious in the flames.
events.significance: This marks the end of the Bluejam Pirates' threat and demonstrates the strength of Ace and Dadan working together. Bluejam likely dies in the fire afterward.

events.title: Gray Terminal Burns
events.description: The fire set by the Bluejam Pirates on behalf of the Goa Kingdom nobles completely engulfs the Gray Terminal. The entire area is destroyed by the flames as part of the plan to 'clean up' before the Celestial Dragon's visit.
events.significance: This event showcases the cruelty of the Goa Kingdom's nobility, willing to burn alive all the poor residents of the Gray Terminal to present a 'clean' appearance to the Celestial Dragon.

themes.description: The episode contrasts Sabo's desperate desire for freedom with the oppressive systems of nobility and the World Government. The Celestial Dragon's attack on Sabo represents the ultimate suppression of individual freedom.
themes.symbolism: Sabo's pirate flag represents his dream of freedom, which is violently destroyed by the Celestial Dragon's bazooka, symbolizing how the World Government crushes those who seek freedom.

themes.description: The episode starkly illustrates the extreme class divide in the One Piece world, showing nobles willing to burn poor people alive and a Celestial Dragon casually murdering a child for the 'crime' of crossing his path.
themes.symbolism: The burning of Gray Terminal represents the nobility's attempt to erase poverty from view rather than address it. The Celestial Dragon's massive ship dwarfing Sabo's tiny fishing boat symbolizes the power imbalance.

themes.description: Multiple characters demonstrate courage and self-sacrifice: Dadan and Ace stay to fight despite the danger, Dragon risks himself to save Sabo, and Sabo chooses uncertain freedom over comfortable captivity.
themes.symbolism: The fire represents both destruction and the trials one must face to achieve freedom. Those willing to face the flames are those with true courage.

characterSpotlights.development: Sabo makes the ultimate choice for freedom, escaping his noble family to pursue his dream of becoming a pirate. His apparent death at the hands of a Celestial Dragon is the tragic climax of his arc.

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime shows how Sabo is recaptured and Sabo's father hires two bodyguards to guard Sabo, which was not shown in the manga.
In the anime, Sabo's parents (Didit and Outlook III) witness his departure on the boat, much to their shock. This was not shown in the manga.

In the manga, Dadan instantly swings her axe at Bluejam at the start of their confrontation. In the anime, Dadan saves Ace by first grabbing onto Bluejam's arm that is carrying the gun and redirecting it.

trivia.fact: This episode adapts Manga Chapter 587 (pages 10-19) and Chapter 588 (pages 2-4).
The episode's TV rating in Japan was 9.0%, ranking 5th for the week.
This is the first time Bartholomew Kuma is shown as a member of the Revolutionary Army in the anime.
Saint Jalmack's attack on Sabo is one of the most infamous Celestial Dragon atrocities shown in the series, demonstrating their complete disregard for human life.
